name: Capri Tiberio Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at the JW Marriott. We are Gold Elite Marriott Rewards members and Marriott timeshare owners, so we stayed for free on points. We were also there for an anniversary, so they said we received an “upgraded” room. We didn’t have a sea or pool view either, but our view wasn’t horrible. Our view was of a small courtyard. Perhaps the upgrade was in the size of the room? Not sure. We enjoyed our room. It was clean, quiet and the AC worked. They also sent us a complimentary bottle of wine to toast our anniversary.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Needs to Honor Marriott Elite Perks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In talking to at least three other couples there on points, there were some disappointments. You do not get what you would normally get as an Elite Marriott Reward member. For instance, there’s no free breakfast. If you’re there on points, you had to really negotiate to get a decent room much less an upgrade, which is typically complimentary if you’re a Gold or Platinum member. The hotel offers upgrades for $150 and up. This hotel exempts itself from a lot of the amenities you would normally get as a rewards member…which is disappointing. The couples I spoke to complained of tiny, tiny rooms with no view. It’s just disappointing that you spend so much money supporting a brand and are not treated with standout service to observe that loyalty. Marriott needs to do better in this regard.
reviews.title: Fabulous location, service and facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the property, it is gorgeous…on par with other luxury Marriotts. The pool (which is both indoors and outdoors) was really nice. It is cold, but still has Jacuzzi style jets. We spent almost every day lounging by the pool. The bed in our room was divine. The shower and toiletries were very nice. The hotel is convenient to nice restaurants and the town square. I can’t speak to the onsite restaurants, as we explored Capri and took advantage of restaurants elsewhere.
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived, there was a worker from Marriott who met us at the ferry, gave us directions to the hotel and tickets to the funicular so we wouldn’t have to stand in line. They also took our bags…however there is a fee for the porter service. I still recommend it, as we got turned around a little bit. We took our bags down ourselves when leaving Capri. The workers at the hotel booked our ferry and train tickets for us for our departure…small fee and definitely worth it. They delivered the tickets to our room the night before.
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay at this hotel again…but would make sure it’s not the height of the season to ensure a decent room. I would not pay the 400 plus Euro per night, but use points.
reviews.title: Great hotel, ok room, aweful bathroom
Horrible Hotel - Do Not Stay Here!
reviews.text: First let me say that I do not usually go online to write a review however our experience at this hotel was so horrible I wanted to warn others. After reading all the reviews warning about booking a standard room though points I called months in advance to get an upgrade. The cost was an extra $250 Euro per night on top of the points we used. Upon arrival they checked us in to a superior room... a room directly over the pool on the 2nd floor where the smoke and loud noise from people below was less than what you expect from a luxury hotel. The view was also lousy. All you see is the dirty rooftops of buildings. After complaining a woman at the front desk told me there were no other rooms available. After having a melt down and asking for the manager of the hotel suddenly another room became available although the views at this hotel are all the same - horrible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we asked for restaurant recommendations, they didn't know of any and there is really no true concierge desk. The food at their restaurant was horrendous - the worst meal we at throughout our entire trip to Italy including breakfast. How you could screw up making eggs is perplexing.
reviews.title: Not a good deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people who work at this hotel should all be fired. They are the rudest people who just don't care about you. The level of service is the worst I have ever experienced at a hotel. And by the way, the hotel was almost empty. Hopefully the word is getting out. If you want to enjoy Capri (which is beautiful!) do not stay here.
reviews.title: Sheer heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok it's Capri but at the end of the day this hotel is absolutely far away from a 5 stars standard. The cost is hight and the quality of the rooms and services is not super.
reviews.title: Home away from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A Neapolitan friend recommended this hotel, perched on a hill overlooking the town of Capri and the sea. Initially, we were skeptical of a hotel bearing the Marriott stamp, as we try to avoid chains, but the hotel helped make our stay in Capri sheer heaven (though Capri is so picture-perfect, it’s hard to imagine any hotel detracting from its charm).
reviews.title: Our first car-less hotel was a special treat!

likes.liked: — The level of service was outstanding.
likes.disliked: — The price of dinner was too high for our budget.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to be able to redeem points for this stay – it was the penultimate day/stop of our Honeymoon and what a treat it turned out to be.
reviews.title: Tiberio Palace - the real deal...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel following the hassle factor of staying on Capri; the ferry, the funicular [read: Zoo] and stomping through the narrow alleyways en-route to the property.
reviews.title: Great Island - Bad Aftertaste

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stepped through the electric, glass doors and were met by cool A/C and equally cool staff – but in a good way. We’d arrived in heaven.
reviews.title: Clean, Beautiful Hotel - Recommend Using Points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was faultless; we were upgraded to a Junior Suite (having expected a room-from-hell as using points) and were excited to see what we’d got.
reviews.title: Beautiful, clean, comfortable, quiet, friendly staff...no complaints!
Nice location, expensive for the room
reviews.text: Junior Suite 201

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would describe my stay at the Marriott Capri as Odd and awkward
reviews.title: Odd and awkward

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent three nights here and while we had a lovely time in Capri, we were quite dissapointed with the Marriott. We had heard good reviews about this hotel and are really unsure why. There is nothing particularly special or unique and the rates are absurdly overpriced - so, I would seriously only recommend this spot if you are using Marriott points (and even in that case would probably recommend going elsewhere). Like some of the other reviews, we were initially placed in a very small room overlooking an ugly outside area with chipped paint and an air conditioning unit. I wasnt expecting a breathtaking view necessarily, but this was absurd. After complaining, we were upgraded to a much nicer room with a decent balcony (although construction noise was an issue at 8 AM each morning).
reviews.title: No flickering lights at the JW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the staff to be a bit arrogant, unhelpful and poorly managed. My interactions with them were (coming back to this theme)....awkward. The staff would walk around the pool area (which needless to say was a very odd place in and of itself - more of the pool was indoor than outdoor and was ICE cold - really, I'm not sure if I would call it a pool at all) but were of no help, other than trying to push their spa services and asking me useless questions about my room number. There was nowhere to get a drink or snack poolside (in fact, when I asked where I could get a quick bite- they sent me hiking up a hill to a grocery store while there was another one just a block away) and no view of anything really. Additionally, I did not realize this until the last day but there was a whole indoor area near the pool with a steam/sauna that I feel like no one knew about, wasnt really staffed and had an ice-cold hot tub with some lounge chairs surrounding...very odd. The place was just odd.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: The other thing I found strange was that the staff had little to no knowledge about the island/restaurants/etc. You would think considering the island is only 4 miles big, they would know about every inch but that was not the case. We found our way though but not because of the staff. The positives of the hotel really have to do with the island itself which is fun for a day or two but not really more. The location of the hotel is quite good and the hotel itself is pretty and clean.
reviews.title: Best breakfast ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used Marriott points for this stay and were wondering if we would be relegated to the hallway with the flickering lights and trash bin view (see previous review ). It was NOT the case. We, too, were celebrating a milestone anniversary (30!), but did not receive a free room upgrade. However, the staff sent us a beautiful bottle of sparkling wine on the house and decorated the bed with rose petals. Our room was small, but lovely. In our experience, most hotel rooms in Europe are smaller than we might see in the US, so this was not unexpected. Our hallway lights did not flicker, our view was of a small terrace and the mountain beyond (not the sea or the trash bins). The room was beautifully appointed. I felt the staff went out of their way to make us comfortable. We ate at the hotel restaurant, White, and had one of our best meals in Italy. We enjoyed the sea view on the lovely front terrace. The JW's location was perfect for walking about Capri, visiting Anacapri and easy arrival from the harbor. Ask for harbor assistance ahead of time and Giovanni will meet you at the dock . He'll have tickets for the funiculare and explain about the baggage. We had him deliver the bags at 10 euros /each on the way to the hotel, because we really didn't know the ropes. The funiculare is a cable car which takes you up the Piazza Umberto I (1.40 euros pp). It was fun. When you reach the piazza, walk through the center and head towards the white arch at the back and to the left of the square. This is Via Le Botteghe. Follow it right to the JW. It is just a 5 minute walk down this charming lane. As we left Capri, we took our bags with us and rolled them down the lane, just like you see many people doing. We easily hopped on the funiculare and made our way down to the ferry. Enjoy Capri, the town is enchanting. Don't get all caught up in the quest to have the world's best seaview from your room. Capri. itself, is all about the views. If you must, be prepared to pay 650 euros for a seaview from your bed. Last of all, be sure to try the Lemon Granita Iced tea at one of the cafes in Piazza Umberto. It's the best!
reviews.title: Do Not Spend Your $s On This Hotel!

description: The Mediterranean soul appears in the optical white used for the accessories, essential and linear, and for the shutters which mark the façade, as well as in the rich Mediterranean plants which decorate the terrace and lobby of the Hotel. When you cross the threshold, you immediately feel you are a guest at the house of a great traveller, richly endowed with reminiscences, feelings and objects. Each space is taken up by seats, niches, mirrors of everyday familiarity, and in each corner, there are libraries for the guests to page through.Eclectic and carefully chosen fittings are to be found in the Lounge and Living area, a mix between Design, memorabilia and vintage items, seen through a new approach based on the use of 50s and 70s optical inspiration fabrics which confer a relaxed yet very high level style on the place, with corners to relax or converse in and reading areas organised in small and comfortable "alcoves".
